definition:
A normed space is said to be [*rotund*]{} if every point of $C(0,1)$ is
an extreme point. Here $C(0,1)$ is the set $\{b: \lVert b \rVert = 1\}$.
Equivalently, a space is rotund if and only if $a \neq b$ and
$\lVert a \rVert = \lVert  b \rVert\leq 1$ implies
$\lVert a+b \rVert < 2$.

A uniformly convex space is rotund.
